Key Match Events: Curry and Jayson Tatum went for 45 points after the intermission
Derrick White's three with 10:19 remaining in the fourth gave Boston an 85-84 lead
Buddy Hield's three with 47 seconds left gave Golden State a 111-104 advantage and sealed the win
Warriors went on a 19-4 run over the next four minutes to go back on top by five
Pre-Game Insights: Stephen Curry explained the Warriors 'haven't done anything yet' despite being tied for the best record in the Western Conference
Warriors became the first team to win in Boston in the regular season since the New York Knicks on April 11
Head coach Steve Kerr is making a point of using everyone he can in games
Post-Match Reflections: Curry scored a season-high 27 points and dished out nine assists against the Celtics
Hield is on the best heater of his career with a 50.7 percent success rate from three-point range on 9.1 attempts per game
The Warriors are playing fantastic all-around basketball, ranking second in defensive rating, third in offensive rating and first in net rating
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Celtics battled back after trailing by as many as 14 points in the third quarter
Both offenses came to life in the second half, scoring a combined 139 points
Others: Warriors' next three games are against the Cleveland Cavaliers (9-0), Oklahoma City Thunder (7-1) and Dallas Mavericks (5-3)
